head.supplied: Circular Head ¶ Tas. ¶ 9th Novr 1879 ¶ Dear Baron ¶ I duly received your note last night ¶ Letter not found. ¶ Strange, I intended writing to you this post forwarding by Rosedale ¶ The steamer Rosedal...

p.seg: RB MSS M141, Library, Royal Botanic Gardens Melbourne.

p.style: font-family: Geneva; font-size: 12pt; text-align: end;
font-family: Geneva; margin-left: 0.3335in; margin-right: 0in; text-indent: -0.3335in; font-size: 9pt;
p.seg: MS found with a specimen of
Notelaea ligustrina
(MEL 2274220). MS annotation by M: 'Answ 17/11/79'. Letter not found.
Circular Head

p.style: font-family: Geneva; margin-left: 0.3335in; margin-right: 0in; text-indent: -0.3335in; font-size: 9pt;
p.seg: Tas.

p.style: font-family: Geneva; font-size: 12pt; text-align: end;
font-family: Geneva; font-size: 12pt;
font-family: Geneva; font-size: 12pt;
p.seg: I duly received your note last night

p.style: font-family: Geneva; margin-left: 0.3335in; margin-right: 0in; text-indent: -0.3335in; font-size: 9pt;
p.seg: Letter not found.

p.style: font-family: Geneva; font-size: 12pt;
p.seg: Strange, I intended writing to you this post forwarding by Rosedale

p.style: font-family: Geneva; margin-left: 0.3335in; margin-right: 0in; text-indent: -0.3335in; font-size: 9pt;
p.seg: The steamer
Rosedale
traded regularly between Melbourne and the north coast of Tas.
care of the agents at Melbourne a small package of shrub leaves &c for your identification or classification

p.style: font-family: Geneva; font-size: 12pt;
p.seg: The specimen showing berries is from a tree about 80 feet high & 2 feet thick. The tree looks very like our common Blackwood but on close inspection differs greatly, I never saw but three specimens — The broad leaved specimen is from the stump of a tree similar in general aspect to the former but the leaves being different shows that it cannot be the same, the trunk had been cut down, but I believe there are one or two more in the neighbourhood of my farm — The third specimen with glossy leaves is from a shrub also in the same neighbourhood but I do not know it.

p.style: font-family: Geneva; font-size: 12pt;
p.seg: I will write to Mr Kaiser at Bischoff and endeavour to get specimens of the Richea P.

p.style: font-family: Geneva; margin-left: 0.3335in; margin-right: 0in; text-indent: -0.3335in; font-size: 9pt;
p.seg: Probably an abbreviation for the species
R. pandanifolia
or
R.
procera
; the same terminology is used in S. Emmett to M, 8 May 1875 (in this edition as 75-05-08a).
or Dracophyllum,

p.style: font-family: Geneva; margin-left: 0.3335in; margin-right: 0in; text-indent: -0.3335in; font-size: 9pt;
p.seg: ? or the related genus
Dracophyllum
? See Bentham (1863-78), vol. 4, pp. 257-65, especially p. 261.
I have a small one growing in my garden

p.style: font-family: Geneva; font-size: 12pt;
p.seg: Your remarks in the Argus

p.style: font-family: Geneva; margin-left: 0.3335in; margin-right: 0in; text-indent: -0.3335in; font-size: 9pt;
p.seg: M to the Editor of the
Argus
, 10 October 1879, p. 7 (in this edition as 79-10-10c) (B79.10.06).
with reference to the Waratah of this place Telopea Truncata was copied by our papers,

p.style: font-family: Geneva; margin-left: 0.3335in; margin-right: 0in; text-indent: -0.3335in; font-size: 9pt;

p.seg: and I was glad of the information my own private duties in the farm prevents my attending to the vegetable kingdom, so that sometimes I feel very much inclined to throw up my work and take a turn in the bush

p.style: font-family: Geneva; font-size: 12pt;
p.seg: I have been quite inundated with applications for the seed of the Waratah

p.style: font-family: Geneva; margin-left: 0.3335in; margin-right: 0in; text-indent: -0.3335in; font-size: 9pt;
p.seg: In his letter to the Editor of the
Argus
, 8 October 1879, p. 10, Emmett had enclosed 'a few seeds, which you can give to your friends'.

p.style: font-family: Geneva; font-size: 12pt; margin-left: 1.75in; margin-right: 0in; text-indent: 0in;
font-family: Geneva; font-size: 12pt; margin-left: 1.75in; margin-right: 0in; text-indent: 0in;
font-family: Geneva; font-size: 12pt; margin-left: 1.75in; margin-right: 0in; text-indent: 0in;
